page.title: 17LOCAL TRAFFIC
page.content: A TRAFFIC SURVEY WAS CONDUCTED LOCALLY ON ONE OF THE MAJOR ROADS IN THE AREA. DURING A TWENTY MINUTE PERIOD A TOTAL OF 672 VEHICLES USED THE ROAD.THE MAJORITY OF THESE WERE HEADING TO AND FROM SHOPPING AREAS AND THE LOCAL BY- PASS.ALTHOUGH MOST PEOPLE WERE TRAVELLING BY CAR,MANY STILL USED THEIR BICYCLES FOR GETTING AROUND LOCALLY. BECAUSE OF THE AMOUNT OF ROAD TRAFFIC TRAVELLING TO AND FROM LONDON MANY LOCAL PEOPLE USE THE TRAIN TO GET INTO THE CITY.A SURVEY AT ONE OF OUR LOCAL STATIONS SHOWED THAT BETWEEN 70 AND 110 TICKETS ARE SOLD ON A WEEKDAY,MOST OF WHICH ARE DAY RETURNS TO INNER LONDON. BOTH ROAD AND RAIL SERVICES IN OUR AREA ARE BUSY EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK.
